alert.note: Alert for Central Ventura County Valleys; Lake Casitas; Ojai Valley; Santa Susana Mountains; Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Southern Ventura County Mountains; Ventura County Beaches; Ventura County Inland Coast; Western Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 14 at 9:41PM PDT until March 15 at 4:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Most of Ventura County south of Lockwood Valley. * WHEN...Until 8 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. Rivers and creeks that may be affected include the Ventura River, San Antonio Creek, Calleguas Creek, Matilija Creek, and Conejo Creek. There may be mudslides and rockslides, especially in and near steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A powerful winter storm is expected to bring heavy rain to the watch area. Rainfall totals of 2 to 4 inches are expected in many areas, with totals up to 6 inches in the foothills and mountains. Rainfall rates of one half inch to one inch per hour are possible during the peak of the storm. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
